objectives: To demonstrate a safe and soft landing on the lunar surface.
To demonstrate rover roving on the Moon.

payloads.name: Chandraâ€™s Surface Thermophysical Experiment (ChaSTE)
payloads.purpose: To measure the thermal properties of the lunar surface.

payloads.name: Instrument for Lunar Seismic Activity (ILSA)
payloads.purpose: To measure seismicity around the landing site.

outcome.summary: Successfully soft-landed on the lunar south pole, making India the fourth country to achieve a lunar landing and the first to land near the south pole. The rover was deployed and conducted experiments for one lunar day.
